"/hr/news/eu-osha-at-the-xx-world-congress-on-safety-and-health-at-work";"hr";"/en/news/eu-osha-at-the-xx-world-congress-on-safety-and-health-at-work";"published";"2014-06-06 15:53:54";"2014-06-06 17:18:21";"2014-06-10 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"EU-OSHA at the XX World Congress on Safety and Health at Work";"<p>   EU-OSHA is an exhibitor and symposium organiser at the XX World Congress on Safety and Health at Work in Frankfurt from 24 to 28 August.</p>";"<p>   EU-OSHA will be present at the stand 30D18 in the exhibiting Hall 3.0., where the following main projects/activities will be presented:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://oshwiki.eu/wiki/Main_Page<@#&>>OSHwiki </a>– Official Launch</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/en<@#&>>2014-2015 Campaign Healthy Workplaces Manage Stress</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/about<@#&>>&nbsp;online interactive risk assessment (OiRA</a>)</p>  <p>   &nbsp;</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/euosha-xx-world-congress<@#&>>Find out more</a></p>";"/hr/news/eu-osha-at-the-xx-world-congress-on-safety-and-health-at-work/XX world congress.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/is/news/eu-osha-at-the-xx-world-congress-on-safety-and-health-at-work";"is";"/en/news/eu-osha-at-the-xx-world-congress-on-safety-and-health-at-work";"published";"2014-06-06 15:53:54";"2014-06-06 17:18:21";"2014-06-10 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"EU-OSHA at the XX World Congress on Safety and Health at Work";"<p>   EU-OSHA is an exhibitor and symposium organiser at the XX World Congress on Safety and Health at Work in Frankfurt from 24 to 28 August.</p>";"<p>   EU-OSHA will be present at the stand 30D18 in the exhibiting Hall 3.0., where the following main projects/activities will be presented:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://oshwiki.eu/wiki/Main_Page<@#&>>OSHwiki </a>– Official Launch</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/en<@#&>>2014-2015 Campaign Healthy Workplaces Manage Stress</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/about<@#&>>&nbsp;online interactive risk assessment (OiRA</a>)</p>  <p>   &nbsp;</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/euosha-xx-world-congress<@#&>>Find out more</a></p>";"/is/news/eu-osha-at-the-xx-world-congress-on-safety-and-health-at-work/XX world congress.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/bg/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"bg";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Професионализъм, партньорства и действия за постигане на ефективна инспекция по труда";"<p>   По време на състоялата се в Женева конференция на Международната асоциация на инспекторите по труда, провеждана два пъти годишно, директорът на EU-OSHA произнесе реч за предизвикателствата и възможностите пред инспекцията по труда.</p>  <p>   Сред основните теми беше засилващото се разнообразие на работната сила и влиянието върху безопасността и здравето при работа, особено при жените работници</p>  <p>   Жените по-често работят на непълен работен ден, в сферата на търговията на дребно и услугите, образованието и здравеопазването. От тези работни среди произтичат специфични предизвикателства по отношение на безопасността и здравето при работа.</p>  <p>   Проучванията показват, че към настоящото ниво на БЗР може да има по-добра насоченост и като цяло то да бъде подобрено по отношение на жените.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Прочетете доклада за новите рискове и тенденции в безопасността и здравето на жените при работа</a>&nbsp;(на английски език)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/bg/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Жените на работното място като приоритетна група</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14-и конгрес на международната асоциация на инспекцията по труда</a></p>";"";"/bg/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/hr/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"hr";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesionalizam, partnerstvo i postizanje učinkovite inspekcije rada";"<p>   Na dvogodišnjoj konferenciji Međunarodnog udruženja inspektora rada u Ženevi, Direktor EU-OSHA-e je kao glavni govornik održao govor o izazovima i mogućnostima s kojima se suočava inspekcija rada.</p> <p>   Jedno od ključnih pitanja su sve raznolikiji djelatnici, a posebice djelatnice i njihov utjecaj na sigurnost i zdravlje na radu.</p> <p>   Žene češće koriste skraćeno radno vrijeme, češće rade u maloprodajnim i uslužnim djelatnostima, obrazovanju i zdravstvenoj skrbi. Određeni izazovi za sigurnost i zdravlje na radu rezultat su ovakvih radnih okruženja.</p> <p>   Istraživanja pokazuju da se sigurnost i zdravlje djelatnica mogu bolje usmjeriti i ukupno poboljšati.</p> <p> <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Pročitajte izvještaj o novim rizicima i trendovima u području sigurnosti i zdravlja djelatnica </a> (na engleskom)</p> <p> <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Djelatnice kao prioritetna skupina</a></p> <p> <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14. kongres Međunarodnog udruženja inspekcije rada</a></p>";"";"/hr/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/de/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"de";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professionalität, Partnerschaften und Leistung für eine wirksame Arbeitsinspektion";"<p>   Anlässlich der halbjährlichen Konferenz der Internationalen Vereinigung für Arbeitsinspektion in Genf hielt die Direktorin der EU-OSHA eine Grundsatzrede zu den Herausforderungen und Chancen für die Arbeitsinspektion.</p>  <p>   Eines der wichtigsten Themen ist die zunehmend unterschiedliche Zusammensetzung der Erwerbsbevölkerung und die damit verbundenen Auswirkungen auf Sicherheit und Gesundheitsschutz bei der Arbeit - insbesondere mit Blick auf Frauen.</p>  <p>   Frauen arbeiten häufiger in Teilzeit, im Einzelhandel und im Dienstleistungsbereich, in Bildung und Gesundheitspflege. Mit diesen Arbeitsumfeldern sind spezifische Herausforderungen für Sicherheit und Gesundheitsschutz bei der Arbeit verbunden.</p>  <p>   Untersuchungen belegen, dass Sicherheit und Gesundheitsschutz bei der Arbeit in ihrer jetzigen Form für Frauen gezielter und insgesamt besser gestaltet werden können.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Link zum Bericht „New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work“</a>&nbsp;(„Neue Risiken und Tendenzen im Bereich Sicherheit und Gesundheitsschutz bei der Arbeit für Frauen“ in englischer Sprache)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/de/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Zum Thema Frauen als Schwerpunktgruppe</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14.&nbsp;Kongress der Internationalen Vereinigung für Arbeitsinspektion</a></p>";"";"/de/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/ro/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"ro";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesionalism, parteneriate şi performanţă în furnizarea de servicii eficiente de inspecţie a muncii";"<p>   Cu ocazia conferinţei bianuale a Asociaţiei internaţionale a Inspecţiei Muncii la Geneva, directorul EU-OSHA a ţinut un discurs de deschidere despre provocările şi oportunităţile legate de inspecţia muncii.</p>  <p>   Unul din aspectele principale este forţa de muncă din ce în ce mai variată şi impactul său asupra securităţii şi sănătăţii la locul de muncă, mai ales în privinţa lucrătorilor de sex feminin.</p>  <p>   Există o probabilitate mult mai mare ca femeile să lucreze cu fracţiune de normă, în industria serviciilor şi în sectorul comerțului cu amănuntul, în educaţie şi asistenţă medicală. Aceste medii de lucru generează provocări specifice privind SSM.</p>  <p>   Cercetările arată că aspectele SSM actuale pot fi mai bine direcţionate şi îmbunătăţite, în general, pentru femei.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Citiţi raportul privind noile riscuri şi tendinţe în ceea ce priveşte sănătatea şi securitatea femeilor la locul de muncă</a>&nbsp;(în engleză)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/ro/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Descoperiţi femeile la locul de muncă în calitate de grup prioritar</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>Al 14-lea Congres al Asociaţiei Internaţionale a Inspecţiei Muncii</a></p>";"";"/ro/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/pl/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"pl";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesjonalizm, partnerstwo i wyniki w działaniach skutecznej inspekcji pracy";"<p>   Na odbywającej się co dwa lata konferencji Międzynarodowego Stowarzyszenia Inspekcji Pracy w Genewie dyrektor EU-OSHA wygłosił przemówienie programowe na temat wyzwań i możliwości stojących przed inspekcją pracy.</p>  <p>   Jednym z głównych zagadnień jest coraz większe zróżnicowanie pracowników i ich wpływ na BHP, a w szczególności pracujących kobiet.</p>  <p>   Kobiety częściej pracują w niepełnym wymiarze czasu pracy oraz w branżach handlu i usług, edukacji i opieki zdrowotnej. Te środowiska pracy wiążą się ze szczególnymi wyzwaniami w zakresie BHP.</p>  <p>   Z badań wynika, że obecne przepisy BHP w większym stopniu ukierunkować na kobiety oraz ulepszyć z myślą o nich.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Przeczytaj sprawozdanie na temat nowych zagrożeń i tendencji dotyczących bezpieczeństwa i zdrowia kobiet w pracy</a>&nbsp;(w języku angielskim)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/pl/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Dowiedz się więcej o kobietach w pracy jako grupie priorytetowej</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14. Kongres Międzynarodowego Stowarzyszenia Inspekcji Pracy</a></p>";"";"/pl/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/fr/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"fr";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professionnalisme, partenariats et performances: une inspection du travail efficace partout dans le monde";"<p>   Lors de la conférence bisannuelle de l'Association internationale de l'inspection du travail, qui s'est tenue à Genève, la directrice d'EU-OSHA a clairement donné le ton en prononçant son allocution sur les défis et opportunités auxquels est confrontée l'inspection du travail.</p>  <p>   Une des problématiques principales est la diversité croissante de la main-d'oeuvre et ses répercussions sur la santé et la sécurité au travail - en particulier pour les travailleurs féminins.</p>  <p>   Les femmes sont davantage susceptibles de travailler à temps partiel et dans les secteurs de la vente au détail, des services, de l'éducation et des soins de santé. Ces environnements de travail sont la cause de défis spécifiques en termes de santé et de sécurité sur le lieu de travail.</p>  <p>   Il ressort des recherches qu'il est possible de mieux cibler et améliorer les conditions actuelles de santé et de sécurité professionnelles pour les femmes.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Lisez le rapport intitulé New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work</a>&nbsp;(en anglais)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/fr/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Explore women at work as a priority group (Information sur les femmes au travail en tant que groupe prioritaire)</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14ème congrès de l'Association internationale de l''inspection du travail</a></p>";"";"/fr/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/sv/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"sv";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Yrkeskunnighet, partnerskap och resultat vid utförande av effektiv yrkesinspektion";"<p>   Arbetsmiljöbyråns direktör höll ett inledningsanförande om de utmatningar och möjligheter som yrkesinspektionerna står inför vid IALI:s konferens i Genève som hålls vart annat år. (IALI, International Association of Labour Inspectors).</p> <p>   En viktig fråga är arbetskraftens ökade mångfald och hur detta påverkar arbetsmiljön - speciellt när det gäller kvinnliga arbetstagare.</p> <p>   Kvinnor arbetar ofta deltid och inom detaljhandel och servicenäringar, utbildning och hälsovård. Dessa arbetsmiljöer ger upphov till särskilda arbetsmiljöutmaningar.</p> <p>   Forskningen visar att det arbetsmiljöarbete som görs för närvarande kan vara bättre målinriktat på och övergripande förbättras för kvinnor.</p> <p> <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Läs rapporten om nya risker och trender i kvinnors arbetsmiljö</a> (på engelska)</p> <p> <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/sv/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Läs mer om kvinnor i arbete som en prioriterad grupp</a></p> <p> <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>IALI:s 14:e kongress</a></p>";"";"/sv/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/sk/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"sk";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesionálny prístup, partnerstvo a efektivita pri vykonávaní účinnej inšpekcie práce.";"<p>   Na bienálnej konferencii Medzinárodnej asociácie inšpekcie práce v Ženeve vystúpila riaditeľka agentúry EU-OSHA s hlavným prejavom o výzvach a príležitostiach, s ktorými sa stretáva inšpekcia práce.</p>  <p>   Jednou z hlavných tém bola rastúca diverzita pracovnej sily a jej vplyv na bezpečnosť a ochranu zdravia pri práci, najmä v radoch pracujúcich žien.</p>  <p>   Ženy častejšie pracujú na čiastočný úväzok, a to najmä v odvetví maloobchodu a služieb, ako aj v oblasti vzdelávania a v zdravotníctve. Takéto pracovné prostredia majú svoje osobitosti v súvislosti s BOZP.</p>  <p>   Výskum ukazuje, že súčasnú situáciu v oblasti BOZP, čo sa týka žien, je možné celkovo cielene zlepšovať</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Prečítajte si správu o nových rizikách a trendoch v oblasti bezpečnosti a ochrany zdravia žien pri práci (New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work)</a>&nbsp;(v angličtine)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/sk/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Informujte sa o ženách pri práci ako prioritnej skupine</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14. kongres Medzinárodnej asociácie inšpekcie práce</a></p>";"";"/sk/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/mt/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"mt";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professjonalità, sħubijiet, u prestazzjoni fit-twassil ta' spezzjoni tax-xogħol effettiva";"<p>   Fil-konferenza biannwali tal-Assoċjazzjoni Internazzjonali tal-Ispetturi tax-Xogħol f'Ġinevra, id-direttur tal-EU-OSHA ta diskors prinċipali dwar l-isfidi u l-opportunitajiet li qed tiffaċċja l-ispezzjoni tax-xogħol.</p>  <p>   Kwistjoni ewlenija hija l-forza tax-xogħol li kull ma jmur qed issir dejjem aktar diversa u l-impatt tagħha fuq is-sikurezza u s-saħħa fuq il-post tax-xogħol - speċjalment fir-rigward tal-ħaddiema nisa.</p>  <p>   Hemm aktar probabilità li n-nisa jkollhom impjiegi part-time u li jaħdmu fl-industriji tas-servizzi u tal-bejgħ bl-imnut kif ukoll fl-edukazzjoni u l-kura tas-saħħa. Dawn l-ambjenti tax-xogħol jirriżultaw fi sfidi speċifiċi għas-sikurezza u s-saħħa fuq il-post tax-xogħol (OSH).</p>  <p>   Ir-riċerka tiżvela li s-sikurezza u s-saħħa fuq il-post tax-xogħol (OSH) tista' tkun immirata aħjar u titjieb b'mod ġenerali għan-nisa.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Aqra r-rapport dwar Riskji u Xejriet Ġodda fis-Sikurezza u s-Saħħa tan-Nisa fuq il-Post tax-Xogħol (New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work)</a>&nbsp;(bl-Ingliż)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/mt/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Esplora lin-nisa fuq il-post tax-xogħol bħala grupp ta' prijorità</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>L-14-il Kungress tal-Assoċjazzjoni Internazzjonali tal-Ispezzjoni tax-Xogħol</a></p>";"";"/mt/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/it/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"it";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professionalità, partnerariati e performance nell’effettuare ispezioni sul lavoro efficaci";"<p>   Durante la conferenza semestrale dell’Associazione internazionale dell’ispezione del lavoro svoltasi a Ginevra, la direttrice dell’EU-OSHA ha tenuto un discorso sulle sfide e le opportunità che si profilano per le ispezioni sul lavoro.</p>  <p>   Una questione centrale è la forza lavoro sempre più eterogenea e il suo impatto sulla SSL (sicurezza e salute sul lavoro) – soprattutto delle lavoratrici.</p>  <p>   Le donne hanno più probabilità di lavorare a tempo parziale e nel settore del commercio al dettaglio e dei servizi, nell’istruzione e nell’assistenza sanitaria. Questi ambienti lavorativi comportano difficoltà specifiche in termini di SSL.</p>  <p>   Dalla ricerca si evince che l’attuale SSL può essere oggetto di misure più mirate per le donne e nel complesso può migliorare.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Leggi la relazione «New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work» (nuovi rischi e tendenze relativi alla salute e sicurezza delle donne sul lavoro)</a>&nbsp;(in inglese)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/it/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Approfondisci la questione delle donne al lavoro come gruppo prioritario</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14° Congresso dell’Associazione internazionale dell’ispezione del lavoro</a></p>";"";"/it/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/cs/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"cs";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesionální přístup, partnerství a efektivita při vykonávání účinné inspekce práce";"<p>   Na konferenci Mezinárodní asociace inspekce práce, která se koná dvakrát ročně a tentokrát je pořádána v Ženevě, vystoupila ředitelka agentury EU-OSHA s ústředním projevem o výzvách a příležitostech, se kterými se setkává inspekce práce.</p> <p>   Jedním z hlavních témat byla rostoucí diverzita pracovní síly a její vliv na bezpečnost a ochranu zdraví při práci, zejména mezi pracujícími ženami.</p> <p>   Ženy častěji pracují na částečný úvazek, a to zejména v odvětví maloobchodu a služeb, vzdělávání a zdravotnictví. Tato pracovní prostředí s sebou přinášejí specifické výzvy v souvislosti s BOZP.</p> <p>   Výzkum ukazuje, že současnou situaci v oblasti BOZP týkající se žen je možné celkově cíleně zlepšovat.</p> <p> <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Přečtěte si zprávu o nových rizicích a trendech v oblasti bezpečnosti a ochrany zdraví žen při práci (New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work)</a> (v angličtině)</p> <p> <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/cs/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Přečtěte si článek o ženách jako o prioritní skupině při práci</a></p> <p> <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14. kongres Mezinárodní asociace inspekce práce</a></p>";"";"/cs/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/et/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"et";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professionaalsuse, partnerlussidemete ja efektiivsuse olulisus tööinspektsioonis";"<p>   Iga kahe aasta tagant peetaval Rahvusvahelise Tööinspektorite Ühingu konverentsil Genfis pidas EU-OSHA direktor põhiettekande, milles ta käsitles tööinspektsiooni võimalusi ja probleeme.</p>  <p>   Üks põhiküsimusi on tööjõu üha suurenev mitmekesisus ja selle mõju eeskätt naistöötajate tööohutusele ja töötervishoiule.</p>  <p>   Naised teevad tavapäraselt rohkem osaajatööd ja töötavad jaekaubanduse, teenuste, hariduse ja tervishoiu sektoris. Neis töökeskkondades on eripärased tööohutus- ja töötervishoiuriskid.</p>  <p>   Uuringud näitavad, et naiste üldist tööohutust ja -tervishoidu saab parandada sihipäraste meetmete abil.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Aruanne „Naistöötajate tööohutuse ja töötervishoiu uued riskid ja suundumused”</a>&nbsp;(inglise keeles)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/et/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Naistöötajad kui prioriteetne rühm</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>Rahvusvahelise Tööinspektorite Ühingu 14. kongress</a></p>";"";"/et/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/es/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"es";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesionalidad, asociaciones y rendimiento para una inspección de trabajo eficaz";"<p>   En la conferencia bianual de la Asociación Internacional de la Inspección de Trabajo celebrada en Ginebra, la directora de la EU-OSHA pronunció un discurso de apertura en el que se refirió a los desafíos y las oportunidades de la inspección de trabajo.</p>  <p>   Una de las cuestiones fundamentales es la creciente diversificación de la mano de obra y las repercusiones que esto conlleva para la seguridad y la salud en el trabajo (SST), especialmente en el caso de las mujeres trabajadoras.</p>  <p>   Las mujeres tienen más probabilidades de trabajar a tiempo parcial y en los sectores minorista y de servicios, en educación y en atención sanitaria. Estos entornos laborales presentan desafíos específicos en materia de SST.</p>  <p>   Las investigaciones ponen de relieve que las condiciones actuales de SST pueden orientarse de una forma más adecuada y en general mejorar para las mujeres.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Leer el informe «New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work» (Nuevos riesgos y tendencias en la seguridad y la salud de las mujeres en el trabajo)</a>&nbsp;(en inglés)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/es/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Leer más sobre las mujeres trabajadoras como grupo prioritario</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14º Congreso de la Asociación Internacional de la Inspección de Trabajo</a></p>";"";"/es/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/nl/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"nl";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professionalisme, partnerschappen en resultaten met doeltreffende arbeidsinspectie";"<p>   Tijdens de tweejaarlijkse conferentie van de Internationale Associatie van arbeidsinspecteurs (International Association of Labour Inspectors - IALI) in Genève, heeft de directrice van EU-OSHA een thematoespraak gehouden over de uitdagingen en kansen voor de arbeidsinspectie.</p>  <p>   Een belangrijk onderwerp is de toenemend heterogene beroepsbevolking en de invloed daarvan op veiligheid en gezondheid op het werk - vooral voor vrouwen.</p>  <p>   Vrouwen werken doorgaans vaker in deeltijd in de kleinhandel en dienstverlenende sectoren, het onderwijs en de gezondheidszorg. Deze werkomgeving stelt hen voor specifieke gezondheids- en veiligheidsproblemen.</p>  <p>   Uit onderzoek blijkt dat het huidige beleid op dit punt in het algemeen verbeterd en meer gericht op vrouwen moet worden.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Lees het verslag over nieuwe risico's en trends op het gebied van veiligheid en gezondheid van vrouwen op de werkplek</a>&nbsp;(in het Engels)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/nl/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Onderzoek naar werkende vrouwen als prioritaire groep</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14e Congres van de Internationale Associatie van arbeidsinspecteurs</a></p>";"";"/nl/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/pt/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"pt";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profissionalismo, parcerias e desempenho na condução de inspeções do trabalho eficazes";"<p>   Na conferência semestral da Associação Internacional da Inspeção do Trabalho em Genebra, a diretora da EU-OSHA proferiu um discurso de abertura sobre os desafios e as oportunidades que se apresentam à inspeção do trabalho.</p>  <p>   Uma questão fundamental é a mão de obra cada vez mais diversificada e o seu impacto sobre a segurança e saúde no trabalho (SST), sobretudo no caso das mulheres trabalhadoras.</p>  <p>   As mulheres têm maior probabilidade de trabalhar em regime de tempo parcial e nas áreas da venda a retalho e dos serviços, da educação e da saúde, ambientes de trabalho que apresentam desafios específicos em termos de SST.</p>  <p>   A investigação indica que a SST atual pode ser mais bem direcionada e melhorada, no global, em benefício das mulheres.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Leia o relatório «New risks and trends in the safety and health of women at work» (Novos Riscos e Tendências em matéria de Segurança e Saúde das Mulheres no Trabalho)</a>&nbsp;(em inglês)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/pt/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Estudar as mulheres no trabalho como grupo prioritário</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14.º Congresso da Associação Internacional da Inspeção do Trabalho</a></p>";"";"/pt/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/hu/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"hu";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Professzionalizmus, partnerség és teljesítmény a hatékony munkaügyi ellenőrzés során";"<p>   A Munkaügyi Ellenőrök Nemzetközi Szövetségének (International Association of Labour Inspectors) évente kétszer megrendezett, ezúttal Genfben tartott konferenciáján az EU-OSHA igazgatója bevezető beszédében a munkaügyi ellenőrzés előtt álló kihívásokat és lehetőségeket hangsúlyozta.</p>  <p>   Az egyik fontos téma az egyre sokszínűbbé váló munkaerő, és annak hatása a munkahelyi biztonságra és egészségvédelemre - főként pedig a női munkavállalókra.</p>  <p>   A nők nagyobb arányban dolgoznak félállásban, illetve a kiskereskedelmi és szolgáltató iparban, az oktatásban vagy az egészségügyben. Ezek a munkakörnyezetek egyedi munkahelyi biztonsági és egészségvédelmi kihívásokat eredményeznek.</p>  <p>   A kutatások szerint a jelenlegi munkahelyi biztonsági és egészségvédelmi körülményeket a nők szempontjából célzottabbá lehetne tenni, valamint összességében javítani lehetne rajtuk.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Olvassa el a New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work című jelentést</a>&nbsp;(angol nyelven)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/hu/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>A női munkavállalók, mint kiemelt csoport</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>A Munkaügyi Ellenőrök Nemzetközi Szövetségének 14. kongresszusa</a></p>";"";"/hu/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/fi/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"fi";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Ammatillisuus, kumppanuus ja suorittaminen tehokkaan työsuojelutarkastuksen toteutuksessa";"<p>   Viraston johtaja piti tärkeän puheen työsuojeluvalvonnan haasteista ja mahdollisuuksista kaksi kertaa vuodessa järjestettävässä IALIn (kansainvälisen työsuojelutarkastusliiton) konferenssissa Genevessä.</p>  <p>   Yksi keskeisistä aiheista oli työvoiman entistä suurempi erilaisuus ja siitä johtuvat vaikutukset etenkin naistyöntekijöiden työterveyteen ja -turvallisuuteen.</p>  <p>   Naiset työskentelevät miehiä todennäköisemmin osa-aikaisesti sekä vähittäiskaupan ja palveluiden, koulutuksen ja terveydenhuollon aloilla. Näissä työympäristöissä on joitakin erityisiä työsuojeluhaasteita.</p>  <p>   Tutkimuksen mukaan nykyistä työsuojelua voi kokonaisuudessaan kohdentaa ja kehittää paremmin naisten tarpeisiin.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Lue raportti naisten työterveyteen ja -turvallisuuteen liittyvistä uusista riskeistä ja suuntauksista</a>&nbsp;(englanniksi)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/fi/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Tarkastele työssä käyviä naisia ensisijaisena ryhmänä</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>IALIn (International Association of Labour Inspection) 14. konferenssi</a></p>";"";"/fi/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/da/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"da";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Et effektivt arbejdstilsyn baseret på professionalisme, partnerskaber og resultater";"<p>   På International Association of Labour Inspection's halvårlige konference i Genève holdt EU-OSHA's direktør som hovedtaler et indlæg om udfordringerne og mulighederne i forbindelse med arbejdstilsyn.</p>  <p>   Et af de centrale punkter er den stadig større diversitet i arbejdsstyrken og virkningen heraf på arbejdsmiljøet - især for kvindelige arbejdstagere.</p>  <p>   Kvinder er mere tilbøjelige til at arbejde på deltid og i detail- og servicesektoren, uddannelsessektoren og sundhedssektoren. I disse arbejdsmiljøer er der specifikke arbejdsmiljøudfordringer.</p>  <p>   Forskning viser, at kvindernes arbejdsmiljø generelt kan målrettes bedre og forbedres.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Læs rapporten <@#&>New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work<@#&></a>&nbsp;(på engelsk)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/da/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Læs mere om kvindelige arbejdstagere som prioriteret gruppe</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>Den 14. kongres i International Association of Labour Inspection</a></p>";"";"/da/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/no/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"no";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesjonalitet, partnerskap og resultater i et effektivt arbeidstilsyn";"<p>   I sitt hovedinnlegg på årets konferanse for den internasjonale sammenslutningen av arbeidstilsyn (International Association of Labour Inspectors) i Genève tok EU-OSHAs direktør opp de utfordringene og mulighetene arbeidstilsynet står overfor.</p>  <p>   Et av hovedtemaene er det økende mangfoldet i arbeidsstokken og hvordan dette påvirker helsen og sikkerheten i arbeidslivet, særlig for kvinnelige arbeidstakere.</p>  <p>   Kvinner jobber oftere deltid og er gjerne ansatt i salg og service, utdanning eller helse og omsorg. Alle disse arbeidsmiljøene har sine egne HMS-utfordringer.</p>  <p>   Forskning viser at nåværende HMS-praksis kan bli mer målrettet og generelt bedre for alle kvinner.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Les rapporten om nye HMS-risikoer og -trender for kvinner på arbeidsplassen</a>&nbsp;(på engelsk)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/no/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Kvinner på arbeidsplassen som en prioritert gruppe</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>Den 14. kongressen for Den internasjonale sammenslutningen av arbeidstilsyn</a></p>";"";"/no/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/lv/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"lv";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Profesionālisms, partnerība un rezultatīvie rādītāji, veicot efektīvas darba inspekcijas";"<p>   Starptautiskās Darba inspekciju asociācijas divreiz gadā notiekošajā konferencē EU–OSHA direktors teica galveno runu par darba inspekciju uzdevumiem un iespējām.</p>  <p>   Viens no galvenajiem tematiem bija aizvien atšķirīgāks darbaspēks, kā arī tā ietekme jo īpaši uz satrādājošo sieviešu darba drošību un veselības aizsardzību.</p>  <p>   Sievietes biežāk strādā nepilnu darba laiku, turklāt mazumtirdzniecības un pakalpojumu nozarē, kā arī izglītības un veselības aizsardzības jomā. Šādas darba vides rezultātā darba drošības un veselības aizsardzības jomā jārisina īpaši uzdevumi.</p>  <p>   Pētījumi atklāj, ka darba drošība un veselības aizsardzība var būt kopumā labāk orientēta uz sievietām un to var uzlabot.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Izlasiet ziņojumu <@#&>New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work<@#&></a>&nbsp;(angļu valodā)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/lv/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Uzziniet vairāk par sievietēm kā prioritāro grupu darba vidē</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>Starptautiskās Darba inspekciju asociācijas 14.&nbsp;kongress</a></p>";"";"/lv/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/lt/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"lt";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Partnerystė ir veikla bei profesionalumas veiksmingame darbo inspekcijos darbe";"<p>   Kas dvejus metus Ženevoje rengiamoje Tarptautinės darbo inspekcijos asociacijos konferencijoje EU-OSHA direktorė perskaitė pagrindinį pranešimą apie darbo inspekcijos veikloje kylančius iššūkius bei atsiveriančias galimybes.</p>  <p>   Vienas svarbiausių klausimų yra didėjanti darbo jėgos įvairovė ir šio reiškinio įtaka darbuotojų, ypač moterų, saugai ir sveikatai.</p>  <p>   Moterys dažniau linkusios dirbti ne visą darbo dieną, taip pat mažmeninės prekybos ir paslaugų srityse bei švietimo ir sveikatos priežiūros sistemose. Tokių darbo vietų aplinka neišvengiamai susijusi su ypatingais DSS keliamais uždaviniais.</p>  <p>   Tyrimais atskleista, kad apskritai dabartinei moterų DSS būtų galima skirti daugiau dėmesio ir šią padėtį pagerinti.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Skaitykite ataskaitą „Nauja dirbančių moterų saugai ir sveikatai kylanti rizika ir tendencijos“</a>&nbsp;(anglų kalba)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/lt/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Susipažinkite su dirbančiomis moterimis kaip prioritetine grupe</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14-asis Tarptautinės darbo inspekcijos asociacijos kongresas</a></p>";"";"/lt/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/el/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"el";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Επαγγελματισμός, συμπράξεις και επιδόσεις για τη διασφάλιση μιας αποτελεσματικής επιθεώρησης εργασίας";"<p>   Στο πλαίσιο του εξαμηνιαίου συνεδρίου της Διεθνούς Ένωσης Επιθεωρήσεων Εργασίας στη Γενεύη, η Διευθύντρια του EU-OSHA πραγματοποίησε κεντρική ομιλία με θέμα τις προκλήσεις και τις ευκαιρίες για τις επιθεωρήσεις εργασίας.</p>  <p>   Ένα από τα βασικά θέματα αποτελεί η αυξανόμενη ποικιλομορφία του εργατικού δυναμικού και ο αντίκτυπος που έχει στην επαγγελματική ασφάλεια και υγεία - ιδίως των εργαζόμενων γυναικών.</p>  <p>   Είναι πιθανότερο να απασχολούνται οι γυναίκες με καθεστώς μερικής απασχόλησης καθώς και στους τομείς του λιανικού εμπορίου, των υπηρεσιών, της εκπαίδευσης και της υγειονομικής περίθαλψης. Αυτά τα εργασιακά περιβάλλοντα συνεπάγονται συγκεκριμένες προκλήσεις στον τομέα της ΕΑΥ.</p>  <p>   Βάσει ερευνών, η ΕΑΥ σήμερα μπορεί να είναι περισσότερο στοχευμένη και βελτιωμένη συνολικά για τις γυναίκες.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Διαβάστε την έκθεση με θέμα <@#&>New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work<@#&> (Νέοι κίνδυνοι και τάσεις στον τομέα της ασφάλειας και της υγείας των γυναικών στην εργασία).</a>&nbsp;(στα αγγλικά)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/el/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Μελετήστε τις γυναίκες στην εργασία ως ομάδα προτεραιότητας</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14ο συνέδριο της Διεθνούς Ένωσης Επιθεωρήσεων Εργασίας</a></p>";"";"/el/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"en";"";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"moral_osha_europa_eu";"Professionalism, partnerships, and performance in delivering effective labour inspection";"<p>   At the biannual conference of the International Association of Labour Inspectors in Geneva, EU-OSHA’s director gave a keynote speech on the challenges and opportunities facing labour inspection.</p>  <p>   One key issue is the increasingly diverse workforce and its impact on occupational safety and health - especially that of women workers.</p>  <p>   Women are more likely to work in part-time roles and in retail and service industries, education and healthcare. These working environments result in specific OSH challenges.</p>  <p>   Research reveals that current OSH can be better targeted and improved overall for women.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Read the report on New Risks and Trends in the Safety and Health of Women at Work</a>&nbsp;(in English)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Explore women at work as a priority group</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14TH Congress of the International Association of Labour Inspection</a></p>";"";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/is/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"is";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Fagmennska, samstarf og góð frammistaða við framkvæmd á skilvirku vinnueftirliti";"<p>   Á ráðstefnu Alþjóðasamtaka vinnueftirlitsmanna í Genf, sem haldin er tvisvar á ári, hélt framkvæmdastjóri EU-OSHA framsögu um áskoranirnar og tækifærin sem vinnueftirlit stendur frammi fyrir.</p>  <p>   Eitt helsta vandamálið er hin vaxandi fjölbreytni í vinnuafli og áhrif hennar á vinnuverndarmál - einkum kvenkyns launþega.</p>  <p>   Kvenmenn eru líklegri til þess að vera í hlutastörfum og starfa við smásölu, þjónustu, menntun og í heilbrigðisgeiranum. Vinnuumhverfi, sem þessi, hafa í för með sér sérstakar áskoranir þegar kemur að vinnuverndarmálum.</p>  <p>   Rannsóknir hafa leitt í ljós að beina má núverandi vinnuvernd betur að konum og bæta hana almennt fyrir þær.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Lesa skýrsluna um nýjar áhættur og þróun í öryggi og heilbrigði kvenna á vinnustöðum</a>&nbsp;(á ensku)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/is/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Lesa um konur á vinnustöðum sem forgangshóp</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14. þing Alþjóðasamtaka vinnueftirlitsmanna</a></p>";"";"/is/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/sl/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"sl";"/en/teaser/iali-conference-2014";"published";"2014-06-02 12:52:08";"2014-07-25 15:49:13";"2014-06-09 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Strokovnost, sklepanje partnerstev in učinkovitost pri izvajanju uspešne inšpekcije dela";"<p>   Na konferenci mednarodne zveze za inšpekcijo dela, ki poteka vsaki dve leti in je letos organizirana v Ženevi, je direktorica agencije EU-OSHA predstavila govor o izzivih in priložnostih na področju inšpekcije dela.</p>  <p>   Eden od ključnih perečih problemov je čedalje bolj raznolika delovna sila in učinek tega pojava na varnost in zdravje pri delu, zlasti kar zadeva zaposlene ženske.</p>  <p>   Ženske so pogosteje zaposlene za skrajšani delovni čas, in sicer v maloprodajnem ali storitvenem sektorju oziroma v izobraževanju ali zdravstvu. Za ta delovna okolja pa so značilni posebni izzivi na področju varnosti in zdravja pri delu.</p>  <p>   Raziskave kažejo, da obstajajo možnosti, da se trenutno stanje na področju varnosti in zdravja pri delu bolj namensko obravnava in izboljša za vso žensko delovno silo.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/new-risks-and-trends-in-the-safety-and-health-of-women-at-work/view<@#&>>Preberite poročilo o novih tveganjih in trendih na področju varnosti in zdravja zaposlenih žensk</a>&nbsp;(v angleščini)</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/sl/priority_groups/gender<@#&>>Preberite več o zaposlenih ženskah kot prednostni skupini</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.iali-aiit.org/resources/congress-2014.pdf<@#&>>14. kongres mednarodne zveze za inšpekcijo dela</a></p>";"";"/sl/teaser/iali-conference-2014/gender.jpg";"";"stress, statistics, gender, research, health_care, maintenance, healthcare, green_jobs, risks";"";"";"";""
"/el/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"el";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/el/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"en";"";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/fr/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"fr";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/fr/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/bg/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"bg";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/bg/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/hr/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"hr";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/hr/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""

It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. "/is/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"is";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. "/it/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"it";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. "/et/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"et";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/et/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/es/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"es";"/en/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020";"published";"2014-06-06 13:17:41";"2014-07-25 15:19:40";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Health and safety at work: Strategic Framework sets out EU objectives for 2014-2020";"<p>   On 6 June the European Commission presented a new Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/es/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""

It identifies key challenges and strategic objectives for occupational safety and health, presents key actions and identifies instruments to address these.</p>  <p>   EU-OSHA’s OiRA tool will play a key part in one of the strategic objectives of the EU Strategic Framework. The OiRA web platform offers free sectoral risk assessment tools, providing practical support to small and micro enterprises to help them to better comply with health and safety rules.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/social/main.jsp?langId=en&amp;catId=89&amp;newsId=2053&amp;furtherNews=yes<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.oiraproject.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about OiRA</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/corporate/eu-osha-multi-annual-strategic-programme-2014-2020/view<@#&>>EU-OSHA Multi-annual Strategic Programme 2014-2020</a></p>";"";"/nl/teaser/health-and-safety-at-work-strategic-framework-sets-out-eu-objectives-for-2014-2020/EU flag.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""

"/en/news/commission-to-propose-an-eu-strategic-framework-on-health-and-safety-at-work";"en";"";"private";"2014-05-27 16:28:50";"2014-06-05 11:37:01";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Commission proposes an EU Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work";"<p>   On 6 June, the Commission presents a new EU Strategic Framework on Health and Safety at Work for the period 2014-2020. It will outline the achievements of EU-level action on health and safety at work and identify the key challenges and strategic objectives for the future.</p>";"<p>   The new Strategic Framework is due to address such issues as further consolidating national health and safety strategies, facilitating compliance (particularly in SMEs), improved enforcement, simplification of existing rules, measures to take account of the ageing workforce and new risks, improving data on work-related accidents and diseases and reinforcing coordination with other international organisations and third countries.</p>  <p>   It also identifies the EU instruments which help implement the Strategic framework such as EU Funds and social dialogue.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://europa.eu/rapid/press-release_AGENDA-14-19_en.htm#__RefHeading__15_931826747<@#&>>Read the EU Commission press release</a></p>";"/en/news/commission-to-propose-an-eu-strategic-framework-on-health-and-safety-at-work/eu_flag.png";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/en/teaser/introducing-the-first-wave-of-official-campaign-partners";"en";"";"private";"2014-06-06 14:46:07";"2014-07-25 16:00:50";"2014-06-06 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Introducing the first wave of official campaign partners";"<p>   More than 60 EU official partners of the 2014–15 Campaign, Healthy Workplaces Manage Stress, have been announced by EU-OSHA.</p>  <p>   Ranging from multinational companies to employers’ and workers’ organisations, they are joined by campaign media partners in promoting the effective management of work-related stress and psychosocial risks.</p>  <p>   The official partners will benefit from increased visibility, networking and learning exchange opportunities and the chance to apply for the inaugural dedicated partners’ Good Practice Award.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/press/press-releases/healthy-workplaces-manage-stress-over-60-organisations-across-europe-join-eu-osha-campaign<@#&>>Read the news release</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/en/campaign-partners/official-campaign-partners<@#&>>See the list of EU official campaign and media partners</a></p>";"";"/en/teaser/introducing-the-first-wave-of-official-campaign-partners/OCP meeting.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/en/news/eu-osha-stimulates-debate-on-workplace-risks-to-reproductivity";"en";"";"published";"2014-06-05 10:51:40";"2014-06-05 10:52:49";"2014-06-05 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"EU-OSHA stimulates debate on workplace risks to reproductivity";"<p>   Various reproductive hazards can be found at the workplace, not only from chemicals, but also from physical, biological, ergonomic or other factors. While the issue of reproductive risks has largely been stigmatised on women, and mostly pregnant women, these risk factors can in fact affect both women's and men's reproductive health and some may also have effects on their children, even on the long term. Awareness at the workplace level is low and targeted information limited.</p>";"<p>   A workshop organised by EU OSHA in cooperation with the French Agency for Food, Environmental and Occupational Health and Safety (ANSES) provided preliminary results of EU-OSHA research, to stimulate debate on workplace risks to reproductivity and to support a constructive dialogue between stakeholders. The research is part of a large-scale activity that the Agency is undertaking to address work-related diseases.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/seminars/workplace-risks-affecting-reproduction-from-knowledge-to-action<@#&>>Download materials from the workshop</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/topics/ds<@#&>>Visit the EU-OSHA dedicated web section on dangerous substances</a></p>";"/en/news/eu-osha-stimulates-debate-on-workplace-risks-to-reproductivity/reprotoxic.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"en";"";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Safe working in the wind energy sector";"<p>   Wind energy is a growing sector, but how safe are its workers? Harmful substances and working at height are examples of risks in this sector that can be intensified by difficult conditions, such as extreme weather.</p>  <p>   Our report provides detailed information about OSH risks and their prevention throughout the various wind turbine life cycle stages and also considers future challenges that the sector needs to address. It is supported by an e-fact giving an overview of the issues and a checklist that identifies common hazards and preventive measures for both onshore and offshore wind farm installations.</p>  <p>   Read the publications:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Report: Occupational safety and health in the wind energy sector </a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-fact: Working safely in the wind energy sector</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Hazard Identification Checklist: Occupational Safety and Health (OSH) risks in the wind energy sector</a><br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/ro/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"ro";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Condiţii de siguranţă în muncă în sectorul energiei eoliene";"<p>   Energia eoliană este un sector în expansiune, dar de câtă siguranţă în muncă beneficiază lucrătorii din acest domeniu? Substanţele periculoase şi munca la înălţime sunt exemple de riscuri din acest sector care pot fi intensificate de condiţiile dificile, precum condiţiile meteorologice extreme.</p>  <p>   Raportul nostru furnizează informaţii detaliate despre riscurile SSM şi despre prevenirea acestora pe parcursul diverselor stadii ale ciclului de viaţă al turbinelor eoliene şi, de asemenea, ia în considerare viitoarele provocări care trebuie abordate în acest sector. Acesta este însoţit de un buletin informativ care oferă o perspectivă de ansamblu asupra problemelor şi conţine o listă a celor mai frecvente pericole şi măsuri preventive pentru facilităţile fermelor eoliene atât de pe continent, cât şi din larg.</p>  <p>   Citiţi publicaţiile:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Raport: Securitatea și sănătatea în muncă în sectorul energiei eoliene</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Buletin informativ: Condiţii de siguranţă în muncă în sectorul energiei eoliene</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Lista pentru identificarea pericolelor: Riscurile pentru sănătatea şi securitatea în muncă (SSM) în sectorul energiei eoliene </a><br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/ro/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/pl/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"pl";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Bezpieczna praca w sektorze energii wiatrowej";"<p>   Energia wiatrowa to rozwijająca dziedzina, ale na ile bezpieczna dla pracowników? Szkodliwe substancje i praca na wysokości stanowią przykłady zagrożeń w tym sektorze, które mogą się nasilić w trudnych warunkach, np. w złych warunkach atmosferycznych.</p>  <p>   Nasze sprawozdanie zawiera szczegółowe informacje na temat zagrożeń BHP i metod zapobiegania im podczas różnych cykli pracy turbiny oraz bierze pod uwagę wyzwania z jakimi sektor będzie musiał sobie poradzić w przyszłości. Ponadto biuletyn e-fakt zawiera przegląd kwestii i listę kontrolną identyfikującą powszechne zagrożenia i środki zapobiegawcze, zarówno dla farm wiatrowych znajdujących się na wodzie, jak i na lądzie.</p>  <p>   Przeczytaj publikacje:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Sprawozdanie: Bezpieczeństwo i higiena pracy w sektorze energii wiatrowej</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-fakt: Bezpieczna praca w sektorze energii wiatrowej</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Lista kontrolna identyfikacji zagrożeń: Bezpieczeństwo i zdrowie w pracy w sektorze energii wiatrowej</a><br />   <br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/pl/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/hr/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"hr";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Sigurni radni uvjeti u sektoru energije vjetra";"<p>   Sektor energije vjetra rastući je sektor, no koliko su sigurni njegovi radnici? Štetne tvari i rad na visini primjeri su rizika u ovom sektoru koji se mogu pogoršati u teškim uvjetima, kao što su iznimni vremenski uvjeti.</p>  <p>   Naš izvještaj pruža detaljne informacije o rizicima za sigurnost i zdravlje na radu i njihovom sprječavanju tijekom različitih stupnjeva životnog ciklusa vjetroturbina te uzima u obzir buduće izazove kojima se sektor treba pozabaviti. Izvještaj je potkrijepljen internetskim čancima e-fact koji pružaju pregled problema te kontrolni popis koji utvrđuje česte opasnosti i preventivne mjere za vjetroelekrane kako na kopnu tako i na moru.</p>  <p>   Pročitajte publikacije:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Izvješće: Sigurnost i zdravlje na radu unutar sektora energije vjetr</a>a</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-fact: Sigurni radni uvjeti u sektoru energije vjetra</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Kontrolni popis za utvrđivanje opasnosti: Rizici za sigurnost i zdravlje na radu u sektoru energije vjetra</a><br />   <br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/hr/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/no/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"no";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Sikkert arbeid i vindkraftbransjen";"<p>   Vindenergi er en bransje i vekst, men hvor sikker er den for de som arbeider der? Farlige stoffer og arbeid i høyden er eksempler på risiko i denne bransjen som kan forsterkes av vanskelige forhold, for eksempel ekstreme værhendelser.</p>  <p>   Rapporten vår gir detaljerte opplysninger om HMS-risikoene på de ulike trinnene i en vindturbins livssyklus og hvordan disse kan forebygges, og tar også opp framtidige utfordringer som bransjen må ta tak i. Rapporten støttes av en e-fact-artikkel som gir en oversikt over problemstillingene og inneholder en sjekkliste som identifiserer vanlige farer og forebyggende tiltak for vindparker både på land og til havs.</p>  <p>   Les publikasjonene:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Rapport: Arbeidstakernes helse og sikkerhet i vindkraftbransjen</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-fact: Sikkert arbeid i vindkraftbransjen</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Sjekkliste for fareidentifikasjon: HMS-risikoer i vindkraftbransjen</a><br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/no/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/fi/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"fi";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Turvallinen työ tuulienergia-alalla";"<p>   Tuulienergia-ala on kasvussa, mutta kuinka turvallista tällä alalla työskenteleminen on? Esim. haitalliset aineet ja korkealla tehtävät työt ovat sellaisia tämän alan riskejä, jotka saattavat voimistua entisestään vaikeiden olosuhteiden kuten äärimmäisten sääolojen seurauksena.</p>  <p>   Raportissamme on yksityiskohtaista tietoa työturvallisuus- ja työterveysriskeistä ja niiden ehkäisemisestä tuuliturbiinien elinkaaren eri vaiheissa. Mukana on myös tietoa tulevista haasteista, joihin alan on vastattava. Raportin tukena oleva e-fact-artikkeli esittää yleiskatsauksen käsiteltäviin aiheisiin sekä tarkistuslistan maalla ja veden päällä sijaitsevien tuulipuistojen tavallisimmista vaaroista ja niiden ehkäisykeinoista.</p>  <p>   Lue julkaisut:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Raportti: Occupational safety and health in the wind energy sector</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-fact: Working safely in the wind energy sector</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Tarkistuslista vaaratekijöiden tunnistamiseen: Työturvallisuus- ja työterveysriskit tuulienergia-alalla</a><br />   <br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/fi/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/cs/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"cs";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Bezpečná práce v odvětví větrné energie";"<p>   Odvětví větrné energie je na vzestupu, na jaké úrovni je však bezpečnost práce těch, kteří v něm působí? Škodlivé látky a práce ve výškách jsou jen některé z rizik v tomto odvětví. Uvedená rizika mohou být ještě vyšší v důsledku náročných podmínek, jako je extrémní počasí.</p>  <p>   Naše zpráva přináší podrobné informace o rizicích v oblasti BOZP a jejich prevenci během různých fází životního cyklu větrných turbín. Zamýšlí se také nad problémy, které bude třeba v tomto odvětví v budoucnosti řešit. Informace uvedené ve zprávě potvrzuje i dokument z řady elektronická fakta (e-fact), který přehledně popisuje danou problematiku a obsahuje kontrolní seznam, jenž určuje společná nebezpečí a preventivní opatření vztahující se na větrné elektrárny na zemi i na moři.</p>  <p>   Přečtěte si tyto publikace:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Zpráva: Bezpečnost a&nbsp;ochrana zdraví při práci v&nbsp;odvětví větrné energie</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-fact: Working safely in the wind energy sector (Elektronická fakta: Bezpečná práce v odvětví větrné energie)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Kontrolní seznam pro rozpoznávání nebezpečí: Rizika v oblasti BOZP v odvětví větrné energie</a><br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/cs/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/is/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"is";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Örugg vinna í vindorkugeiranum";"<p>   Vindorka er vaxandi atvinnugrein en hversu örugg er hún fyrir starfsmennina? Hættuleg efni og vinna í hæð eru dæmi um áhættur í greininni sem geta magnast af völdum erfiðra aðstæðna eins og slæms veðurs.</p>  <p>   Skýrslan okkar veitir ítarlegar upplýsingar um vinnuverndaráhættur og forvarnir gegn þeim á líftíma ýmiss konar vindhverfla auk þess að taka mið af þeim framtíðaráskorunum sem atvinnugreinin þarf að leysa úr. Með henni fylgir e-staðreyndir þar sem finna má yfirlit yfir vandamálin og gátlista yfir algengar hættur og forvarnir bæði fyrir vindstöðvar á landi og sjó.</p>  <p>   Lesa ritið:</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Skýrsla: Vinnuverndaráhættur í vindorkugeiranum</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-79-occupational-safety-and-health-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>E-staðreyndir: Örugg vinna í vindorkugeiranum</a></p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/e-facts/e-fact-80-hazard-identification-checklist-occupational-safety-and-health-osh-risks-in-the-wind-energy-sector/view<@#&>>Gátlisti fyrir hættugreiningu: Vinnuverndaráhættur í vindorkugeiranum</a><br />   <br />   &nbsp;</p>";"";"/is/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector/wind energy.jpg";"";"green_jobs";"";"";"";""
"/pt/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"pt";"/en/teaser/safe-working-in-the-wind-energy-sector";"published";"2014-04-14 16:29:19";"2014-07-25 10:48:03";"2014-06-03 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Trabalhar em segurança no setor da energia eólica";"<p>   A energia eólica é um setor em expansão, mas qual é o nível de segurança e saúde das pessoas que nele trabalham? A exposição a substâncias nocivas e o trabalho em altura são exemplos dos riscos no setor, os quais podem ser agravados por condições difíceis, nomeadamente condições atmosféricas extremas.</p>  <p>   O nosso relatório fornece informação sobre os riscos de SST e sua prevenção ao longo das várias fases do ciclo de vida das turbinas eólicas e analisa igualmente os desafios futuros que este setor terá de superar.
