Jame daugiausia diskutuota apie tai, ką daryti su EU-OSHA perspektyviniame tyrime nustatytais naujais ir kylančiais pavojais ir kaip kurti saugesnes ir sveikesnes ekologiškas darbo vietas ateičiai.</p>  <p>   Šio <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>seminaro medžiagos santraukoje</a> rasite Europos politikams, profesinių sąjungų atstovams ir darbdaviams skirtą informaciją apie ekologiškų darbo vietų planavimą ir šios srities sprendimų priėmimą.</p>  <p>   Seminaras parengtas remiantis EU-OSHA užsakymu dvejus metus vykdyto perspektyvinio tyrimo išvadomis.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Skaityti išsamias perspektyvinio tyrimo ataskaitos išvadas (anglų kalba)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/lt/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Daugiau informacijos apie darbuotojų saugą ir sveikatą ekologiškose darbo vietose</a></p>";"";"/lt/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/hu/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"hu";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Hogyan kezelhetőek az új és újonnan felmerülő biztonsági és egészségvédelmi kockázatok a zöld munkahelyeken?";"<p>   A zöld ágazat gyorsan fejlődik, így valószínűleg új és újonnan felmerülő kockázatok fognak felbukkani. Éppen ezért 2013 novemberében Bilbaóban műhelymunkát rendeztünk a munkahelyi biztonság és egészségvédelem terén illetékes nemzeti hatóságokból álló hálózatunkkal. A megbeszélés az EU-OSHA előrejelző tanulmányában azonosított új és újonnan felmerülő kockázatok kezelésére fókuszált, és arra, hogyan jöhetnek létre a jövőben biztonságosabb és egészségesebb zöld munkahelyek.</p>  <p>   A <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>műhelymunka összefoglalója</a> az európai döntéshozók, szakszervezetek és munkaadók számára nyújt információkat a tervezésről és a döntéshozatalról a zöld munkahelyek terén.</p>  <p>   A műhelymunka az EU-OSHA megbízásából készített kétéves előrejelző tanulmány következtetésein alapult.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>A tanulmány következtetései az előrejelző jelentésben (angolul)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/hu/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Bővebben a zöld munkahelyek munkahelyi biztonságáról és egészségvédelméről</a></p>";"";"/hu/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/fi/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"fi";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Miten käsitellä uusia ja kehittyviä terveys- ja turvallisuusriskejä vihreillä työpaikoilla?";"<p>   Nopeasti laajenevalla vihreiden työpaikkojen sektorilla syntyy todennäköisesti uusia ja kehittyviä riskejä. Siksi pidimme kansallisten työsuojeluviranomaisten kanssa tätä aihetta käsitelleen työpajan Bilbaossa marraskuussa 2013. Keskustelu keskittyi siihen, miten käsitellä EU-OSHAn ennakointitutkimuksessa tunnistettuja uusia ja kehittyviä riskejä sekä siihen miten luoda turvallisempia ja terveellisempiä työpaikkoja tulevaisuudessa.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Yhteenveto työpajasta</a> antaa eurooppalaisille päätöksentekijöille, ammattiliitoille ja työnantajille tietoa vihreisiin työpaikkoihin liittyvästä suunnittelusta ja päätöksenteosta.</p>  <p>   Työpaja pohjautui EU-OSHAn tilaaman kaksivuotisen ennakointitutkimuksen tuloksiin.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Lue raportista kaikki ennakointitutkimuksen tulokset (englanniksi)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/fi/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Pähkinänkuoressa lisätietoja työsuojelusta vihreillä työpaikoilla</a></p>";"";"/fi/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/da/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"da";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Hvordan håndteres nye og fremvoksende arbejdsmiljørisici i grønne job?";"<p>   I den hastigt voksende sektor for grønne job udvikler der sig sandsynligvis nye og fremvoksende risici. Derfor afholdt agenturet i november 2013 en workshop i Bilbao med sit netværk af nationale arbejdstilsynsmyndigheder. I debatten blev der fokuseret på, hvordan man håndterer de nye og fremvoksende risici, der fremgår af EU-OSHA's fremsynsundersøgelse, samt hvordan man fremover skaber sikrere og sundere grønne job.</p>  <p>   Der er udarbejdet en <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>sammenfatning af workshoppen</a>, der henvender sig til europæiske beslutningstagere, fagforeninger og arbejdsgivere, og som indeholder oplysninger om planlægning og beslutningstagning i grønne job.</p>  <p>   Udgangspunktet for workshoppen var resultaterne af en toårig fremsynsundersøgelse iværksat af EU-OSHA.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Læs alle undersøgelsesresultaterne i fremsynsrapporten (på engelsk)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/da/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Yderligere kortfattede oplysninger om arbejdsmiljø i grønne job</a></p>";"";"/da/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/es/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"es";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Nuevos y futuros riesgos en los empleos verdes: cómo abordarlos";"<p>   El sector de los empleos verdes es un sector en rápida expansión donde es probable que surjan riesgos nuevos y emergentes. Por este motivo, en noviembre de 2013, organizamos un seminario en Bilbao con nuestra red de autoridades nacionales de seguridad y salud en el trabajo. El debate se centró en la manera de abordar los riesgos nuevos y emergentes identificados en el estudio prospectivo de la EU-OSHA y en cómo crear empleos verdes más seguros y saludables en el futuro.</p>  <p>   En el <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>resumen del seminario,</a> se ofrece información sobre la planificación y la toma de decisiones en materia de empleos verdes dirigida a los responsables políticos, sindicatos y empresarios de Europa.</p>  <p>   El seminario se basó en los resultados del estudio prospectivo, de dos años de duración, encargado por la EU-OSHA.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Leer los resultados del estudio prospectivo (en inglés)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/es/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Más información sobre la SST en los empleos verdes: visión de conjunto</a></p>";"";"/es/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/nl/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"nl";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Hoe pakken we de nieuwe veiligheids- en gezondheidsproblemen in groene banen aan?";"<p>   Met de sterke opkomst van groene banen zullen er waarschijnlijk ook nieuwe risico's ontstaan. Daarom hebben we in november 2013 in Bilbao met ons netwerk van nationale instanties een workshop gehouden over veiligheid en gezondheid op het werk. De nadruk lag daarbij op hoe we de nieuwe risico's die EU-OSHA’s prognosestudie had blootgelegd kunnen aanpakken en ervoor kunnen zorgen dat groene banen in de toekomst veiliger en gezonder zijn.</p>  <p>   Het <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>overzicht van de workshop</a> bevat informatie over planning en besluitvorming op het gebied van groene banen, bedoeld voor Europese beleidsmakers, vakbonden en werkgevers.</p>  <p>   De workshop was gebaseerd op de bevindingen van een twee jaar durende prognosestudie die EU-OSHA in opdracht had gegeven.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Lees de volledige resultaten van de studie in het prognoseverslag (in het Engels)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/nl/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Meer beknopte informatie over veiligheid en gezondheid op het werk in groene banen</a></p>";"";"/nl/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/pt/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"pt";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Como abordar os riscos de segurança e saúde novos e emergentes nos empregos verdes?";"<p>   O setor dos empregos verdes é um setor em rápida expansão, onde é provável que surjam riscos novos e emergentes. É por esse motivo que organizámos um seminário em novembro de 2013, em Bilbau, com a nossa rede de autoridades nacionais em matéria de segurança e saúde no trabalho. Os trabalhos centraram-se nas formas de abordar os riscos novos e emergentes identificados no estudo prospetivo da EU-OSHA e em como criar empregos verdes mais seguros e saudáveis no futuro.</p>  <p>   Uma <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>síntese do seminário</a> contém informações sobre o planeamento e o processo de tomada de decisões em matéria de empregos verdes destinadas aos decisores políticos, sindicatos e trabalhadores europeus.</p>  <p>   O seminário baseou-se nos resultados de um estudo prospetivo de dois anos encomendado pela EU-OSHA.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Leia o relatório prospetivo para conhecer todos os resultados do estudo (em inglês)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/pt/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Mais informações sobre a SST nos empregos verdes num relance</a></p>";"";"/pt/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/sl/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"sl";"/en/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs";"published";"2014-03-06 12:01:05";"2014-07-25 15:48:17";"2014-03-17 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Kako se lotiti novih in nastajajočih tveganj glede varnosti in zdravja na zelenih delovnih mestih?";"<p>   Število zelenih delovnih mest naglo narašča, kar pomeni veliko verjetnost za pojav tveganj. Novembra 2013 smo zato v v Bilbau v sodelovanju z našo mrežo nacionalnih organov organizirali delavnico o varnosti in zdravju pri delu. Osrednje vprašanje je bilo, kako se lotiti novih in nastajajočih tveganj, opredeljenih v pripravljalni študiji agencije EU-OSHA, ter kako za prihodnost ustvariti varnejša in bolj zdrava zelena delovna mesta.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>Povzetek delavnice</a> vsebuje informacije o načrtovanju in sprejemanju odločitev glede zelenih delovnih mest. Te so namenjene zlasti evropskim oblikovalcem politike, sindikatom in delodajalcem.</p>  <p>   Delavnica je temeljila na izsledkih dvoletne pripravljalne študije, ki jo je naročila agencija EU-OSHA.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/en/publications/reports/foresight-on-new-and-emerging-risks-associated-with-new-technologies-by-2020-workshop-for-eu-focal-points/view<@#&>>V pripravljalnem poročilu preberite izsledke študije v celoti (v angleščini)</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/sl/topics/green-jobs<@#&>>Več informacij o varnosti in zdravju pri delu na zelenih delovnih mestih na kratko</a></p>";"";"/sl/teaser/how-to-address-new-and-emerging-safety-and-health-risks-in-green-jobs/green jobs.jpg";"";"noValueSelected";"";"noValueSelected";"";""
"/en/news/echa-harmonised-classification-labelling-consultations-for-e-glass-fibres-glass-fibres-and-dicyclohexyl-phthalate";"en";"";"published";"2014-03-13 14:41:04";"2014-03-13 14:41:29";"2014-03-14 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"ECHA-Harmonised classification & labelling - consultations for E-glass fibres, glass fibres and dicyclohexyl phthalate";"<p>   The CLH reports for E-glass fibres and glass fibres of representative composition, submitted by France, propose respectively classification for Carcinogenicity 1B (H350i with note R) and Carcinogenicity 2 (H351 with note R) according to the CLP Regulation (1272/2008). The fibres are used in applications such as general or specific air and liquid filtration in industry, public and residential buildings, separation in battery and insulation in aeronautics.</p>";"<p>   The CLH report for dicyclohexyl phthalate, submitted by Sweden, proposes classification for reproductive toxicity and skin sensitisation. The substance is a common plasticiser in the production of various polymer resins (including nitrocellulose and polyvinyl chloride) and is also used in paper finishes and printing inks.</p>  <p>   The public consultation for the three substances opens on 5 March and the deadline for submitting comments is 22 April 2014.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://echa.europa.eu/harmonised-classification-and-labelling-consultation<@#&>>Current consultations</a></p>";"/en/news/echa-harmonised-classification-labelling-consultations-for-e-glass-fibres-glass-fibres-and-dicyclohexyl-phthalate/ECHA_logo_new.jpg";"";"";"";"";"";""
"/el/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"el";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/el/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"en";"";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""

"/de/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"de";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/de/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/da/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"da";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/da/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/ro/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"ro";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/ro/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/pl/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"pl";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/pl/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/et/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"et";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/et/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/es/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"es";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/es/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/lv/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"lv";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/lv/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""

During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/lt/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""

During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/fi/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/hu/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"hu";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/hu/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/sv/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"sv";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/sv/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/sk/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"sk";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/sk/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/fr/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"fr";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/fr/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/bg/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"bg";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/bg/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""

"/pt/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"pt";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. "/no/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"no";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. "/mt/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"mt";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/mt/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/sl/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"sl";"/en/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress";"published";"2014-03-10 10:43:40";"2014-07-25 15:38:57";"2014-03-13 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Healthy Workplaces Campaign Partnership meeting: Managing stress makes sound business sense";"<p>   With less than a month to go before the official launch of the new Healthy Workplaces Campaign, EU-OSHA is calling on international and European organisations and companies to join the 2014-15 HWC Partnership meeting, which takes place on 8th of April in Brussels.</p>  <p>   The event will see the contributions of leading European businesses, workers’ and employers’ organisations, and the interventions of European occupational safety and health experts. During the meeting the new Official Campaign Partnership Offer will be presented, featuring new opportunities for Partners such as the new dedicated OCP Good Practice Award at European level, and more networking and learning- exchange opportunities, such as the Benchmarking initiatives.</p>  <p>   European and international organisations and companies are invited to join a forum of leading public and private organisations to discuss how to get involved in the 2014-15 Campaign, and effectively manage stress and psychosocial risks in the workplace.</p>  <p>   Contact us to register to the meeting:events@healthy-workplaces.eu</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/campaign-partnership-offer.pdf<@#&>>2014-15 Official Campaign Partnership Offer</a><br />   <a href=<@#&>http://www.healthy-workplaces.eu/<@#&>>Learn more about the Healthy Workplaces Campaigns</a></p>";"";"/sl/teaser/healthy-workplaces-campaign-partnership-meeting-managing-stress/campaign partners.jpg";"";"campaign_2014_15";"";"";"";""
"/en/news/de-atypical-employment-is-gender-specific";"en";"";"published";"2014-03-12 17:34:35";"2014-03-13 09:29:08";"2014-03-13 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"DE - Atypical employment is gender-specific";"<p>   Although both genders are affected by precarious employment, statistics reveal significant differences between men and women. While 71 % of temporary workers are men, part-time work is dominated by 86 % of women. This is the conclusion of the annual report <@#&>Health and Safety at Work 2012<@#&> ( SuGA ) of the Federal Institute for Occupational Safety and Health ( BAuA) on behalf of the Federal Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs (BMAS ). The report provides a statistical overview of the world of work , working conditions and occupational health and safety.</p>";"<p>   The focus of the SuGA 2012&nbsp; is <@#&> atypical employment <@#&>, including part-time workers with a maximum of 20 hours per week , minor and temporary employment and contracts of short duration, as well as self-employed without employees and shiftworkers . Of approximately 40 million persons in employment in Germany about 36 million are attributable to the core labour force - that is workers between 15 and 64 years who are not in education, training or military or voluntary service. Of the core workforce in turn more than a fifth is employed atypically, ie eight million. In 2012, five million are part- timers up to 20 hours per week, the so-called mini-jobs, 86 % of whom were female. The proportion of part-time work for men increases with age and is significantly over-represented in the age group <@#&> 55-64 <@#&> - 31 % as compared&nbsp; to 18 % overall.</p>  <p>   The proportion of workers who work in shifts reached a high of 15.9 %. Nearly as many work constantly or regularly on Sundays or public holidays, 13.9 % in 2012. The shares for evening or night work and Saturday work have remained largely stable. The same applies to the part-time rate of 27 %, it slightly increased in men (9.9 % ), but decreased in women (45.8 %).</p>  <p>   Other results of the SuGA:</p>  <ul>   <li>    Employment has continued to rise, reaching 41.6 million in 2012 compared to 41.2 million in 2011.</li>   <li>    After 2009, for the second time after 2009 there were less than a million reportable accidents, but fatal accidents have increased to 677 accidents, 13 more than in the previous year.</li>   <li>    Each worker was on average 14 days unable to work. There is a notable increase in musculoskeletal disorders, which in 2012 accounted for 122 million days lost (23.4 %). Across all diagnoses , there were 522 million working days lost . 60 million of them ( 11.4 per cent ) were related to behavioural and mental disorders. The cost to the German economy was estimated by BAuA at 53 billion euros .</li>  </ul>  <p>   The SUGA is based on information from statutory accident insurance and the Federal Statistical Office , the pension system, various health insurance companies, the Labour Inspectorate and the BIBB / BAuA employment survey.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://www.baua.de/dok/4747830<@#&>>Download the report (in DE)</a></p>";"/en/news/de-atypical-employment-is-gender-specific/Baua.gif";"";"gender, statistics, risk_observatory, accident_prevention";"";"";"";""
"/en/news/eu-health-and-safety-commission-adopts-new-decision-setting-up-the-scientific-committee-on-occupational-exposure-limits";"en";"";"published";"2014-03-13 09:35:32";"2014-03-13 09:36:05";"2014-03-13 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"EU - Health and safety: Commission adopts new decision setting up the Scientific Committee on Occupational Exposure Limits";"<p>   The European Commission has adopted a new decision setting up a Scientific Committee on Occupational Exposure Limits (SCOEL) for Chemical Agents.<br />   This decision repeals Commission Decision 95/320/EC, which set up SCOEL in 1995.</p>";"<p>   <strong>What is SCOEL</strong></p>  <p>   SCOEL assists the Commission in evaluating the latest available scientific data to assess the potential for chemicals to affect workers' health.<br />   In particular, it provides recommendations and opinions on priority chemical substances, which are used by the Commission to set limit values for the protection of workers from exposure to chemical risks, as per Directives <a href=<@#&>http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:1998:131:0011:0023:EN:PDF<@#&>>98/24/EC</a> and <a href=<@#&>http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2004:229:0023:0034:EN:PDF<@#&>>2004/37/EC</a>.</p>  <p>   <strong>What is new</strong></p>  <p>   The <a href=<@#&>http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2014:062:0018:0022:EN:PDF<@#&>>new decision</a> aligns the functioning of SCOEL with the <a href=<@#&>http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=faq.faq&amp;aide=2<@#&>>Commission’s rules on expert groups</a>. For this purpose:</p>  <ul>   <li>    &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; it establishes a new selection procedure of the members through an open call for expression of interest, to be launched shortly, ensuring the principles of transparency and equal opportunities for highly qualified and specialised scientific experts;</li>   <li>    &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; it reinforces the continued importance of the ethical principles of excellence, independence and impartiality as the grounds for the functioning of SCOEL;</li>   <li>    &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; it foresees the granting of special allowances to the members.</li>  </ul>  <p>   <strong>Why a new decision</strong></p>  <p>   Although the new decision maintains many of the provisions of the Decision 95/320/EC, substantive amendments have been made. Therefore, in the interest of legal clarity, it was considered more appropriate to repeal and replace the existing decision.</p>  <p>   <a href=<@#&>http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=OJ:L:2014:062:0018:0022:EN:PDF<@#&>>Read the Decision</a></p>";"/en/news/eu-health-and-safety-commission-adopts-new-decision-setting-up-the-scientific-committee-on-occupational-exposure-limits/EU.jpg";"";"dangerous_substances, legislation";"";"";"";""
"/en/news/eu-prior-informed-consent";"en";"";"published";"2014-03-11 16:51:36";"2014-03-11 16:53:09";"2014-03-12 00:00:00";"dimitrovan";"EU - Prior Informed Consent";"<p>   <strong>New EU Regulation for export and import of hazardous chemicals enters into operation.</strong></p>  <p>   From 1 March 2014, new rules concerning the export and import of very hazardous chemicals will be implemented, when the revised Prior Informed Consent (PIC) Regulation becomes operational. At the same time, the European Chemicals Agency (ECHA) will take over the administrative and technical responsibility from the Joint Research Centre of the European Commission.</p>";"<p>   <a href=<@#&>http://echa.europa.eu/view-article/-/journal_content/title/new-eu-regulation-for-export-and-import-of-hazardous-chemicals-enters-into-operation<@#&>>Read ECHA's press release</a></p>";"/en/news/eu-prior-informed-consent/ECHA_logo_new.jpg";"";"dangerous_substances";"";"";"";""

"/nl/teaser/have-your-say";"nl";"/en/teaser/have-your-say";"published";"2014-02-04 11:07:50";"2014-07-25 15:16:59";"2014-03-10 02:00:00";"dimitrovan";"Het woord is aan u!";"<p>   Het Europese Agentschap voor Veiligheid en Gezondheid op het Werk (<a href=<@#&>https://osha.europa.eu/nl<@#&>>EU-OSHA</a>) voert een onderzoek uit om feedback op zijn activiteiten en de bereikte resultaten te krijgen. Wij vragen u om ons te helpen dit te doen door een korte vragenlijst in te vullen, wat niet meer dan 15 minuten van uw tijd zal kosten. Het onderzoek wordt voor EU-OSHA uitgevoerd door het Britse onderzoeksinstituut <a href=<@#&>http://www.employment-studies.co.uk/main/index.php<@#&>>IES</a> (Institute for Employment Studies).</p>  <p>   De vragenlijst kan in alle officiële EU-talen, en IJslands en Noors, worden ingevuld.
